result.execSummary:
The defendant THOMAS JAMES HOUSE was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If revoked, Defendant entitled to 6 days credit.

miscConds.notes: Bond applied to Fine and Costs.  Paid in Full.  Balance returned to Surety.

Complete compas assessment,  counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate and followup. 

Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections and follow rules of supervision. 

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.  Contact Court Security at 920-236-4906 to schedule an appointment.  The appointment location is:  Room 15 on the lower level of the Courthouse, 415 Jackson Street Oshkosh WI.  Defendant shall provide proof of identification along with the court minutes stating a DNA sample is required.  Failure to comply with this order may result in either a finding of contempt of court or a criminal charge of Failure to Provide a DNA Sample pursuant to Wis. Stats., 946.52.
No use or possession of controlled substances, unless prescribed by a physician.   No possession of drug paraphernalia.
